Self-assured.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="820257"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=820257#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent818711" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc818711" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MeThePerson"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/752819"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.752819.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MeThePerson" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/L-Artisan-Parfumeur/Amour-Nocturne-18755.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18755.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Amour Nocturne"title="Amour Nocturne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma818711ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd818711" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/752819">MeThePerson</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-05-02">05/02/17 09:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Trying to work my way through Penhaligon's fragrances at given opportunities and today I applied Hammam Bouquet. It is now between 5-6 hrs after I sprayed the back of my hand and it's only just getting to a stage of development that is bearable to ME... The immediate opening to me was neat rum!... but for the following 5 hrs all I have been able to think is 'old people's fragrance'... a humid and honeyed rose in the height of Summer is the main note right now which I find still too bitter and(as others have said)an overpowering 'dirty floral' with an incredible amount of ionene. <br />
Definitely a heavy floral on my skin, not one I can appreciate and as such can not offer a better or more impassioned review. <br />
<br />
However, if I were to offer my eyes closed description... <br />
'Old vase water with the stamens from the vast bunch of white Lillies decomposing'.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="818711"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=818711#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent813451" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc813451" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="randy.devost1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/164214"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.164214.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="randy.devost1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma813451ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd813451" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/164214">randy.devost1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-17">04/17/17 12:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Up close It goes on a strong powdery rose, emphasized by lavender and musk. To me, it's like walking in a foggy victorian rose garden during the hottest and most humid day of a London summer. When the rose-scent dies down, it reveals the other notes. However, the rose always seems to cling on nicely. It's at this point where you can smell a slight back-waft of urea which is probably just the orris root coming through. Some people describe it as a dirty floral base note. As a man, this dirtiness is why I'm not averse to wearing a floral. In fact I quite like the idea of "dirtied" florals. Does anyone know of any other fragrances that do this?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="813451"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=813451#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent790193" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc790193" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MEOWITSTERRA"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/585360"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.585360.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MEOWITSTERRA" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lush/Rose-Jam-2019-63243.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.63243.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose Jam 2019"title="Rose Jam 2019"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma790193ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd790193" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/585360">MEOWITSTERRA</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-02-06">02/06/17 22:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a very tricky one, and it is the oldest style fragrance I've ever worn aside from sniffing Mitsouko once. <br />
<br />
The beginning was not pleasant at all, smelling of musty flowers, moss, and wood with cat urine.<br />
<br />
After giving it an hour, it turns into this pretty honeyed green rose with some suede and I also can detect sandalwood. <br />
<br />
It is not something I'd wear personally, but I am super happy to sample a piece of perfume history. What a different world it was.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="790193"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=790193#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent784110" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc784110" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="weegee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11063"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.11063.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="weegee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/La-Couche-du-Diable-55547.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55547.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Couche du Diable"title="La Couche du Diable"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma784110ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd784110" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11063">weegee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-01-21">01/21/17 22:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligon's Hammam Bouquet was introduced nearly 150 years ago as a fragrance for men but I suspect this would be considered strictly a feminine fragrance now, except for the most confident and elegant of men who could, indeed, carry this off if they applied sparingly.  For women though, Hammam Bouquet is a grand incense and deeply dark, sweet rose fragrance with a rich, woody base.<br />
<br />
Reminds me most of Hermes' Rouge with its churchy incense feeling but Hammam Bouquet differs in an important way: it features a pronounced lipstick note that's thick and nearly waxy. And the warmth of Hermes' Rouge is replaced in HB by a cool wind that's almost ozonic. <br />
<br />
Hammam Bouquet is a truly intoxicating and complex fragrance that's refreshingly different from current florals and fruity/candy fragrances smelled everywhere on everyone.  Respectable 6-8 hour longevity makes this a good buy at currently available discounted prices (esp on frag net).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="784110"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=784110#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent775699" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc775699" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rosesbecomeme"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/8568"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.8568.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rosesbecomeme" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma775699ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd775699" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc756627" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Redpula"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/126594"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.126594.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Redpula" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Green-Irish-Tweed-474.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.474.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Green Irish Tweed"title="Green Irish Tweed"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma756627ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd756627" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/126594">Redpula</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-10-29">10/29/16 10:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is not for me. Yes I love rose and could smell it but the blend with other flowers like jasmine and heavy lavender plus soft citrus, orris root and pronounced cedar makes it a revolting, waxy and airy bouquet that I just can't approve as its causing sharp stings to my nose. <br />
It's not too powdery but very waxy that I also detected a mimosa "impression", which I do not go well with. <br />
I am not a fan of cedar and mimosa, so I thumbs down on this bouquet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="756627"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=756627#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent754537" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Waxy Rose, very long lasting.   Lavender softens up and stays strong for about 8 hours, then turns powdery musky at the end.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="754537"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=754537#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent720418" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc720418" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="F2097"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="F2097" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma720418ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd720418" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212">F2097</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-07-03">07/03/16 14:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my favourite Penhaligons fragrance so far. I find it comfortable to wear. I love the backstory and history of it. Some of these old perfumes are too musky and have a mothball note. Hammam is is sharp, masculine and catches the back of your throat. The rose here is clouded in steam, it has a diluted quality that stops it from taking over. You can smell grit and gravel in there, a metallic note like old copper pipes or brass finishings. I wear this almost every day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="720418"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=720418#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent701553" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc701553" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jamiljames"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934469"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.934469.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jamiljames" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/The-Library-Collection-Opus-VI-14661.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14661.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Library Collection Opus VI"title="The Library Collection Opus VI"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma701553ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd701553" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934469">Jamiljames</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-05-01">05/01/16 13:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My original review stated that this does not wear well on my skin. However I have changed my mind completely regarding this fragrance. Its one that you can dislike but eventually fall deeply in love with it. Similar to Blenheim Bouquet it is a fragrance deeply rooted in the past. However it still has the ability to appear appeal to modern times. I really like how the rose is soft and hazy. It works so well with the musky tones. Initially my thoughts of this fragrance were that it smells like an old dusty hallway. It used to remind me of the smell of an old Victorian House- There is a smell of flowers, as well as a coal fire burning. I have found on my skin that the smell is sweeter than on paper. This fragrance can really grow on you in time. It will not appeal to all surely but it is a special fragrance full of character.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="701553"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=701553#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent649025" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc649025" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AZ"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7317"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.7317.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AZ" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma649025ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd649025" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7317">AZ</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-11-18">11/18/15 01:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It very nice fragrance smells like oil spa to give you a quick idea.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="649025"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=649025#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent634794" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc634794" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nero77"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/207815"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.207815.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nero77" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/The-Dua-Brand/Dua-s-Vanillac-Aoud-80749.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.80749.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dua's Vanillac Aoud"title="Dua's Vanillac Aoud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma634794ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd634794" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/207815">nero77</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-09-30">09/30/15 14:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A waxy, decadent, poetic beauty...<br />
<br />
What an intriguing fragrance! It's hard to imagine anything like this would come out of Victorian London! So rich, so decadent! So very beautifully made!<br />
<br />
<i>Hammam Bouquet</i> is an Orientalist fantasy. In the late 19th Century, the Victorians were obsessed with everything "exotic" and unusual. They had a fascination with all things from Asia and the Middle East. In this case, the ritual of the <i>hammam</i> (<b>حمام</b>) or what was known as the "Turkish Bathhouse". These were places where men would go for the ritual of bathing and relaxation, much like the Romans before them. Inside would be a luxury experience of high quality soap, hot scented towels, and perfumed oil. Much like a spa nowadays. <br />
<br />
So the "hammam" which this fragrance was inspired by was located in Jermyn Street, London. The same street which William Penhaligon opened his shop. It proved the inspiration for his fragrance. <br />
<br />
Now, for me, what I get out of this, is a beautifully made, hand crafted gem which is really of another world. It has waxy, dusty orris root and carnation, sensual, gorgeous rose and jasmine, surrounded by a base of civet, amber and sandalwood. There is something so laid back and decadent about this one, so sensual and seductive... that I am surprised it was created by a Victorian man. The Victorians themselves were repressed emotionally and sexually, and they adored tales of the <i>1001 Nights</i>, tales of decadence, intrigue and exoticism. In a way, this fragrance represents that. Exoticism in a bottle I would say.<br />
<br />
So, for me it's exactly what I like in a fragrance. It suits my taste very well. Yes, it is like <i>Chergui</i> by <i>Serge Lutens</i>, but it's also much more than that. This is like a window into the past. It transports me. Personally if you want something really different you should try it out first. 100% niche quality here. Very impressed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="634794"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=634794#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent623449" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc623449" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jamiljames"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934469"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.934469.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jamiljames" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/The-Library-Collection-Opus-VI-14661.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14661.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Library Collection Opus VI"title="The Library Collection Opus VI"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma623449ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd623449" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934469">Jamiljames</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-08-23">08/23/15 08:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really want to love this fragrance but still cannot after years of trying. It in my mind has a dirty musky smell and does not wear well on my skin. This is one of the few Penhaligon's fragrance which does not work well with my skin. I really wish I that I could wear this but it does not agree with me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="623449"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=623449#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent607475" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc607475" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Yushcan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/489924"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.489924.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Yushcan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Roja-Dove/Elysium-Pour-Homme-Parfum-Cologne-46296.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46296.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Elysium Pour Homme Parfum Cologne"title="Elysium Pour Homme Parfum Cologne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma607475ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd607475" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/489924">Yushcan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-06-26">06/26/15 13:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I had an intention to buy Hamam. Tested it. In one hour completely the same as SL Chergui, no difference at all!!! Having one of them do not need other one, definitely!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="607475"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=607475#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent574884" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc574884" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="randy.devost1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/164214"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.164214.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="randy.devost1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma574884ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd574884" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/164214">randy.devost1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-03-07">03/07/15 19:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I sprayed this on my flannel bedding, interested in seeing what it'd do to the general atmosphere, and let me just say, "Wow!" It's inspiring me to go fetch a vintage novel, cigar, and Scotch! It creates such a musty shaving-cream smell, that I can definitely see where there'd be a potential for excitement. I hear what some female reviewers were saying about it reminding them of old men. There is truth to that. In fact, my pillow smells the way I'd hope to smell as an old man. That is, as someone who's lasted through a by-gone era, perhaps alone in life, but accompanied by nostalgic memories of his well-used virility. He might struggle in his old age, but he's sure had a damn good life!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="574884"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=574884#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent563283" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc563283" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Finisterle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/28873"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.28873.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Finisterle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Fragrance-World/Royal-Blend-94022.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.94022.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Royal Blend"title="Royal Blend"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma563283ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd563283" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/28873">Finisterle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-01-29">01/29/15 03:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Hammam Bouquet encases the wearer in a very solid armor of dried roses and sulphurous baths.<br />
<br />
The purpose of the scent is to protect the wearer against the foul smells of Victorian England. The cities polluted by factories and coal smoke from every house. The bad hygiene of the masses and the smell of omnipresent horses drawing cabs and wagons.<br />
<br />
Equally suited for men and women but nothing like the light unisex fragrances produced today.<br />
<br />
A very potent time machine. You won't regret buying it because it is a unique entity but you probably won't want to buy it a second time.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="563283"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=563283#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent557767" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc557767" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mojtabaa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/851797"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.851797.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mojtabaa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma557767ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd557767" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/851797">Mojtabaa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-01-12">01/12/15 08:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The word "Hammam" means "bathroom" in Persian.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="557767"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=557767#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent474127" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc474127" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vanillatonka"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/608869"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="vanillatonka" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma474127ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd474127" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/608869">vanillatonka</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-04-08">04/08/14 20:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>After doing (minimal, I might add) research on the Penhaligon's house, I purchased this particular fragrance somewhat blind as it was on sale at half the price. <br />
It is definitely a unique fragrance, different than anything I've had before. It smells like opening a time capsule or chest,filled with old perfume bottles soaps and towels,  the scent of antiquity. The rose comes through strong, but not sharp ... more blunted, not by the other obvious scents of musk, lavender, amber and woodsy notes ... but the rose smells almost aged, not in a bad way though ... <br />
Reaction to it on me has been from subtly being told it's not that great to a woman who absolutely LOVED the scent on me ..<br />
This is definitely not a signature scent for me and I will probably wear it less or layer it with another scent that brightens the composition ... <br />
I do like the longevity and if I spray it on in the morning, I can still smell it on my chest in the evening.. toned way down and very soothing ... I'd say this can be unisex, but in a strange way ..</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="474127"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=474127#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent466734" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc466734" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Redbeard"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.537021.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Redbeard" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma466734ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd466734" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021">Redbeard</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-03-15">03/15/14 09:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Hammam Bouquet is very difficult for me because the florals are so heavy and overpowering. Smelling it again, I don't find it as immediately "old lady" smelling as I did before, but I still doubt I could ever wear it. Most heavy masculine florals are unappealing to me, though, so if they're your thing then don't let me dissuade you. It reminds me of two Aramis scents...JHL, which is more leathery in a way that I don't like, and 900, which is a cleaner, more rose-centric scent (the one masculine rose I've found that makes sense to my nose!). I would take 900 over Hammam Bouquet or most others in the genre, but I still recognize the depths of HB's richness.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="466734"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=466734#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent463736" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc463736" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ParfumFetiche"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/612959"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.612959.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ParfumFetiche" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lush/Salarium-56382.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56382.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Salarium"title="Salarium"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma463736ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd463736" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/612959">ParfumFetiche</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-03-05">03/05/14 22:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This review is based on a tiny decant. I get mostly rose on top together with some sandalwood and musk. Once it moves to the mid, rose fades away and joins in by orris root. At this point, it kinda reminds me of Mouchoir de Monsieur by Guerlain (without the dirty note). It's not as musky as the name implies. Opening is little loud then quickly moves closer to skin with moderate projection and longevity (6 hrs) on my skin. I like classic English scents of bygone era but this doesn't work for me at current stage. Definitely worth a try if your love is in the vein of MdM/Jicky.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="463736"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=463736#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent458144" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc458144" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Errol the Flynn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/700054"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Errol the Flynn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atkinsons/The-British-Bouquet-18972.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18972.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The British Bouquet"title="The British Bouquet"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma458144ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd458144" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/700054">Errol the Flynn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-02-17">02/17/14 15:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Hamman is Rose ...rose ....rose!!! Penhaligons have created a potent juice here, but only if you like roses. This stuff  must be one of the strongest and longest lasting floral scents I have worn. This scent is basically Oscar Wilde in a bottle. Flamboyant,  Overpowering, mysterious, dandyish and perhaps a little too feminine for a man to wear. It is quality in a bottle and a little spray will last for hours. My wife loves this scent, but it I needs to be worn sparingly or the smell of roses will fill the room. To sum up this scent with an Oscar Wilde quote for this scent....... " There is only one thing worse than being talked about....and that's not being talked about.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="458144"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=458144#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent449801" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc449801" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pianomanmiller"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/463569"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.463569.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pianomanmiller" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Cuir-Beluga-1019.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1019.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cuir Béluga"title="Cuir Béluga"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma449801ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd449801" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/463569">pianomanmiller</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-01-24">01/24/14 20:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have to repost user "the good life"'s description just so I can remember it!<br />
Orientalism captured in a bottle. This is the olfactory complement to Ingres’ Turkish Bath, which is, of course, what a Hammam is. A brilliant projection of repressed Victorian sexuality upon the foil of an imaginary Araby. Fantasies of a Sultan’s absolute power and unrestrained sexual indulgence with unlimited numbers of women, of reversing the strict codes of the British social veneer in the dreamland that Stephen Marcus, in The Other Victorians, labeled Pornotopia. What better way of scentualizing these desires but by combining the rich floral power of rose attar and the violet-like orris, supported by slightly dirty jasmine, with cedar and resins adding just enough oriental spiciness, rounded off with with the smell of sex created by musky notes. Hamman, we realize, is just a code for what a Victorian perfume could not be called, despite deliberately intending the association: Harem bouquet. This smells like a heady opulent boudoir in which people have just had sex, pure and simple. And certainly everybody in fine society knew this and yet did not – Victorian doublethink. Few scents could be richer in cultural history and this, seriously, should be smelled by students in seminars on the Victorian Era, British imperialism, Orientalism - and gender history, since quite likely many present-day individuals would experience gender confusion here, associating femininity (perhaps even of the Queen Mum sort) with the floral aspects and then stumbling over the sexual-animalic component.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="449801"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=449801#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent446864" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc446864" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ahmadmohee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/633090"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.633090.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ahmadmohee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma446864ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd446864" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85); padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc438897" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Q80"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/698615"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.698615.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Q80" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma438897ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd438897" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/640135">saurivaa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-09-20">09/20/13 05:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I just adore this perfume. It's a kind of beeswax on me, very warm, very cosy, some honey. Absolutely unisex.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="408187"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=408187#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent403362" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc403362" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lavaman"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/148843"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.148843.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lavaman" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma403362ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd403362" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/148843">lavaman</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-09-05">09/05/13 22:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of my Favorites..  People keep mentioning the baby powder experience which can only be attributed to the rose and jasmine. I wouldn't refer to it as stale but a dry floral. It is a very quirky fragrance where the top notes of lime and lavender almost vanish completely after a few seconds and you think the scent dies instantly but then after few minutes you notice the rose,jasmine and cedar come alive ever so softly but lasting for a couple of hours. The musky sandlewood dry down is very satifyng. Not usually a big fan of musk but in Hammam Bouquet they utilised just the right amount. The amber somewhat clings to the cedar. I really can't see anyone disliking this fragrance. Yes it is unisex but it pushes toward a really good quality complex fragrance suitable for a gentlmen</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="403362"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=403362#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent367327" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc367327" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="aiobhan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/512292"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.512292.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="aiobhan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Michel-Germain/Sexual-Sugar-10533.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10533.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sexual Sugar"title="Sexual Sugar"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma367327ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd367327" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/512292">aiobhan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-05-16">05/16/13 21:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really wanted to like Hammam Boquet, but it just smells so syrupy-sweet on my skin. The rose and lavender come through, and a touch of the muskiness of the amber, but mostly it's just too sweet.<br />
<br />
For reference, my skin loves amber, iris, vanilla and sandalwood, but doesn't like leather or smoke.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="367327"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=367327#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent343275" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc343275" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="victoria.rogers.984"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/435682"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.435682.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="victoria.rogers.984" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tocca/Cleopatra-4839.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4839.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cleopatra"title="Cleopatra"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma343275ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd343275" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/435682">victoria.rogers.984</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-03-07">03/07/13 06:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was really, really excited to try this one.  Alas, on me, it smelled of baby powder.  My husband thought so, co-workers thought so. . .  I was really disappointed.  Maybe it was simply my body chemistry, or I got a bad sample, but it was really one note on me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="343275"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=343275#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent295691" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
