padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/314919">vmann393</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-10-19">10/19/12 15:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very nicely done by the penhailgon's house i get the spice and the rose little bit of floral. Also projection is pretty good</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="295691"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=295691#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent281823" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc281823" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pumpkintime"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/34199"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="pumpkintime" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Benefit/Something-about-Sofia-6164.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6164.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Something about Sofia"title="Something about Sofia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma281823ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd281823" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/34199">pumpkintime</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-09-02">09/02/12 14:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was curious about this scent, especially after seeing so many conflicting accounts of wearers' experiences with it.<br />
<br />
I bought a bottle and sprayed my wrist and collarbone (left and right): this scent on me recalls the dry down of Chanel No. 5 parfum as it was 20 years ago. <br />
<br />
Colour me happy that I took the plunge (but test it for yourself before you do anything quite as reckless with your money!).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="281823"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=281823#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent269482" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc269482" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="marmalator"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/143698"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="marmalator" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Escentric-Molecules/Escentric-01-846.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.846.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Escentric 01"title="Escentric 01"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma269482ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd269482" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/143698">marmalator</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-07-19">07/19/12 19:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I eventually bought this after sniffing it longingly from a sample vial for two or three years, having first read about it in Juliet Nicholson's superb book, "The Perfect Summer" (all about the latter days of Edwardian England). I don't wear it as much as I would like because it is so bold and floral, not at all like lightweight modern male fragrances (presumably because we now have daily showers, deodorant and don't chain-smoke cigars). It is harder to pull off successfully today, as it was created in an age when the only people who could afford it were rich gentlemen of leisure. <br />
<br />
However, I absolutely love it and still think it really works a room. Hammam Bouquet is an extremely complex scent that develops beautifully and lasts forever. It's got a viscous, oily quality and is a rich golden colour. Despite the heavy and dominant rose, it is a completely masculine scent due to the underlying lavender note and muskiness. I don't find this at all feminine, and have been complimented on how clean and fresh I smell wearing it. It's not 'dirty' or old-fashioned, at least not on me. Projection and sillage are outstanding and unrivalled even by costlier, newer creations. I love wearing this to the theatre or a smart club. When you wear this, you feel special and exclusive. I imagine myself knocking back a large Scotch with King Edward VII over a game of bridge at Boodles. Fin de siecle decadence in a bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="269482"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=269482#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent256697" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc256697" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="d_l_esmond"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/225943"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.225943.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="d_l_esmond" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma256697ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd256697" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/225943">d_l_esmond</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-06-04">06/04/12 15:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought this blind as I could not get hold of tester anywhere. Which is probably a good thing, as I wouldn’t have bought it after only one try. It is a complicated scent that requires some hard work before one can start enjoying it, probably one of the most complex fragrances I’ve tried so far. <br />
Thinking about it now, I would say this is a Wagnerian fragrance, in more than one sense. It won’t gratify at the first time, on the contrary, it can be discordant and aggressive. But with some persistence, it becomes harmonious and rewarding. The rose is the leitmotif across the stages, metamorphic, changing registers, but persistent. This is how the love potion in Tristan and Isolda would have smelt, intoxicating, repulsive and seductive at the same time, sensual and magical. But then maybe this is how the audience would have smelt at a Wagnerian premiere, a scent of a bygone time, opulent and mature. <br />
 Lavender, some citrus and sandalwood come and go, creating a clever impression of whiskey.  Long lasting, with a powdery and sandalwood finish. This is not for the faint hearted or the mundane!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="256697"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=256697#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent256142" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc256142" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="prot72"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/8275"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.8275.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="prot72" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Acca-Kappa/Myscent-150-56998.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56998.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Myscent 150"title="Myscent 150"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma256142ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd256142" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/8275">prot72</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-06-02">06/02/12 11:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Such incredibly beautiful rose scent. Have you been in Rituals store with natural cosmetics? If yes, there you are... This store smell like HB. Rose some deep woods and soapy freshness. Really nice and unique. It has also kind of vintage sting but not like for old ladies, it is rather ancient barber shop. Highly recommended for everybody who likes rose based male fragrances.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="256142"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=256142#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent192507" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc192507" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aur-ha-kadosh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11123"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.11123.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aur-ha-kadosh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma192507ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd192507" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11123">Aur-ha-kadosh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-10-26">10/26/11 05:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>very lavandery scent, seems to look like a fresh eau de toilette but in the very first meaning when you take a bath or after a hammam you could use this to parachieve your cleansing, for me this is not a perfume</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="192507"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=192507#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent146681" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc146681" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Papi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/40703"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.40703.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Papi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma146681ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd146681" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/40703">Papi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-05-12">05/12/11 12:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like dirty toilet seat mixed with faded flowers. Certainly not for me. I guess older women will love it.<br />
<br />
Actually, somebody recommended it to me, I am happy I got only a sample not a bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="146681"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=146681#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent145807" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc145807" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="karlovonamesti"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/19849"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.19849.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="karlovonamesti" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.472.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Silver Mountain Water"title="Silver Mountain Water"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma145807ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd145807" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/19849">karlovonamesti</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-05-09">05/09/11 20:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Basically a stale, somewhat powdery rose and sandalwood affair. Hammam Bouquet smells of gentle antiquity, and all in a good way, although I feel some reservations about praising it too highly. At the same time, I don't want to damn it with faint praise, either. Let me try to find some middle ground - this fragrance lives up to its reputation as an original unisex Turkish bath "bouquet" in the proper English tradition. However, time has not really been all that kind to Hammam. The current formula is a bit synthetic-smelling, with chemical overtures that threaten the otherwise lovely ambiance this type of scent creates. It's good in theory, terrific on paper, lovely in practice, but not entirely realized in reality. Try it and see if you can get past its powdery, vintage feel. There's a challenge to wearing Hammam, and I don't think I'm up for it, at least not as it stands right now.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="145807"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=145807#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent104893" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc104893" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="harlequin1572"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/32935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.32935.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="harlequin1572" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma104893ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd104893" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/32935">harlequin1572</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-10-09">10/09/10 10:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I refuse to see the "dusty old books" description of this perfume, particularly popular outside of Fragrantica, as a bad thing.  Sorry to have to resort to a story (once again!) but this one is just too appropriate.<br />
<br />
A few years ago, I had to spend a lot of time doing research in one of the largest libraries in the world - 3 million books on 50+ miles of bookshelves.  If any part of you is a bookworm, you'll know that I'm not exaggerating when I say that the feeling of hushed awe and grandeur in a place like that is greater than in Louvre and Hermitage combined.  That place was/is stuffed silly with first editions and only existing copies, which anyone could read if you were only willing to trek many hundreds of feet along dark winding corridors and underground tunnels where you were lucky to find another person to ask for directions back to daylight.<br />
<br />
And once I made the wonderful mistake of trying to walk out of that library through one of the fiction floors.  I guess part of me wanted to see if _Necronomicon_ would reveal itself to me, but instead I stumbled on another book I've never read before - Bram Stoker's _Dracula_ (I wasn't surprised when it turned out to be a first edition). Naturally, after reading the first couple of pages, I didn't notice how I made myself comfortable right there on the floor until hours later a librarian came through telling me the place was now closing for the night.<br />
<br />
Those few hours were the most bone-chilling of my life.  The oppressive darkness, my lonely helplessness, the masterfully creepy book, and most noticeable: the smell of age and experience many times greater than the length of my own life... I didn't doubt for a second that I'd be overcome by a horror I couldn't fend off; it was just a matter of when.  The poor librarian who startled me from my trance was probably momentarily as scared as I was when I jumped up out of the gloom with wild eyes upon hearing his voice.<br />
<br />
From then on, I could never refuse the absolutely haunting smell of the ages that makes you feel the weight of ancient knowledge with the simultaneous sense of your own insignificance and protection from things past.  Dusty old books indeed!  Try reading a classic while wearing this perfume - you will never want to watch tv again.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="104893"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=104893#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent84337" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc84337" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ouch!"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/15485"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.15485.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ouch!" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Profumum-Roma/Patchouly-3892.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3892.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Patchouly"title="Patchouly"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma84337ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd84337" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/15485">Ouch!</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-06-09">06/09/10 08:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A boquet indeed! This is defintaly a boquet of flowers but to my nose it smells like they've been dusted in baby powder.<br />
The opening of this perfume is so soft...the musk and amber seem to be very dominant. So unusual for a perfume...the powdery amber is usually the closing notes..not with this.<br />
<br />
A powdery, almost masculine opening then changes somwehat. The perfume still retains a softness in the drydown and throughout wearing but the other flowers are starting to come forward more..<br />
<br />
This could be described a "Heady" but the amber and musk in this are so beautiful they are keeping the other notes in check.<br />
<br />
It ends up being a very well blended but also very complex floral smell.<br />
Quite stunning!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="84337"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=84337#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent64752" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc64752" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="1blondeangel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/14117"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.14117.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="1blondeangel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Libre-56077.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56077.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Libre"title="Libre"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma64752ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd64752" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/14117">1blondeangel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-02-01">02/01/10 17:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligon's Description:<br />
Inspired by the scent of the Turkish Baths on Jermyn Street, Piccadilly, Hammam Bouquet is an daring oriental created by William Penhaligon in 1872. Animalic and golden, it is warm and mature, redolent of old books, powdered resins and ancient rooms. At its heart is dusky Turkish rose, with jasmine, woods, musk and powdery orris. Heady and glamorous, Hammam Bouquet is evocative of the Edwardian era of decadence and excess.<br />
<br />
My Description of edt:<br />
Mature, old books, powder, ancient rooms-YEP for sure...mix it with a deadly strong dose of Green Grass and a nursing home and there you have it! In the south we have a green grass called Johnson Grass that grows really tall if unkempt &amp; is literally "sharp" it can cut you if you run your hand along it. It has a super strong "green" smell, not a fragrant green either. The fragrance does tame after a bit.....into a 100 year old powder that is. Not a fan of this one at all!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="64752"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=64752#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent46109" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc46109" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="the_good_life"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/12275"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="the_good_life" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Wood-Organics/Usiku-5124.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5124.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Usiku"title="Usiku"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma46109ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd46109" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/12275">the_good_life</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2009-09-16">09/16/09 02:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Orientalism captured in a bottle. This is the olfactory complement to Ingres’ Turkish Bath, which is, of course, what a Hammam is. A brilliant projection of repressed Victorian sexuality upon the foil of an imaginary Araby. Fantasies of a Sultan’s absolute power and unrestrained sexual indulgence with unlimited numbers of women, of reversing the strict codes of the British social veneer in the dreamland that Stephen Marcus, in The Other Victorians, labeled Pornotopia. What better way of scentualizing these desires but by combining the rich floral power of rose attar, naughty jasmine, and the violet-like orris, supported by a hint of cedar that adds a traces of oriental spiciness, with the smell of sex created by musk and amber. Hamman, we realize, is just a code for what a Victorian perfume could not be called, despite deliberately intending the association: Harem bouquet. This smells like a heady opulent boudoir in which people have just had sex, pure and simple. And certainly everybody in fine society knew this and yet did not – Victorian doublethink. Few scents could be richer in cultural history and this, seriously, should be smelled by students in seminars on the Victorian Era, British imperialism, Orientalism - and gender history, since quite likely many present-day individuals would experience gender confusion here, associating femininity (perhaps even of the Queen Mum sort)with the flowery aspects and then stumbling over the sexual-animalic component.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="46109"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=46109#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent27847" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc27847" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rosesbecomeme"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/8568"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.8568.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rosesbecomeme" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma27847ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd27847" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/8568">rosesbecomeme</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2009-03-28">03/28/09 07:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very unisex indeed . I'd love to get my husband to wear it . I wear it alongside it's sister Malabah. A great perfume to found a perfumery on. I wish it came in pure perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="27847"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=27847#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent24850" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc24850" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cimbal_ess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/8930"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="cimbal_ess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/The-Beat-2092.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2092.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Beat"title="The Beat"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma24850ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd24850" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/8930">cimbal_ess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2009-03-01">03/01/09 14:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I LOVE U PENHALIGONS, please open a boutique in toronto at least, i can't go to Vegas anytime i want to smell classic.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="24850"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=24850#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent21824" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc21824" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Auguszta"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/6973"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.6973.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Auguszta" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfum-d-Empire/Aziyade-5347.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5347.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aziyade"title="Aziyade"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma21824ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd21824" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/6973">Auguszta</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2009-02-04">02/04/09 05:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a secret love affair going on with this scent... I don't know if I'm ready to wear this in public, but I keep applying it in the privacy of my home, solely for my very own enjoyment, as if it was my dirty little secret, some kind of guilt-inducing pleasure. It opens with an overload of exotic spices, heavy, rich, some might say even a bit masculine or suffocating, but in about 10 minutes it develops into the most wonderful, dark and deeply mysterious rose scent I have ever encountered. I generally don't even like scents that focus on rose, but this intoxicates me like no other. It stays pretty close to the skin so in the end, when it gets to that lovely, still not too sweet, powdery phase, you'll find me sniffing my arm like a mad hound to find the spot. Must be love, love, love.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="21824"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=21824#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent15331" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc15331" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="afraafra"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1159"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1159.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="afraafra" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/L-Homme-Ideal-Eau-de-Parfum-37735.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.37735.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L’Homme Ideal Eau de Parfum"title="L’Homme Ideal Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma15331ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd15331" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1159">afraafra</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2008-12-01">12/01/08 09:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Great soft opening and musky drydown, very unisex</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="15331"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=15331#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent104893" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc104893" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="harlequin1572"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/32935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.32935.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="harlequin1572" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma104893ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd104893" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/32935">harlequin1572</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-10-09">10/09/10 10:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I refuse to see the "dusty old books" description of this perfume, particularly popular outside of Fragrantica, as a bad thing.  Sorry to have to resort to a story (once again!) but this one is just too appropriate.<br />
<br />
A few years ago, I had to spend a lot of time doing research in one of the largest libraries in the world - 3 million books on 50+ miles of bookshelves.  If any part of you is a bookworm, you'll know that I'm not exaggerating when I say that the feeling of hushed awe and grandeur in a place like that is greater than in Louvre and Hermitage combined.  That place was/is stuffed silly with first editions and only existing copies, which anyone could read if you were only willing to trek many hundreds of feet along dark winding corridors and underground tunnels where you were lucky to find another person to ask for directions back to daylight.<br />
<br />
And once I made the wonderful mistake of trying to walk out of that library through one of the fiction floors.  I guess part of me wanted to see if _Necronomicon_ would reveal itself to me, but instead I stumbled on another book I've never read before - Bram Stoker's _Dracula_ (I wasn't surprised when it turned out to be a first edition). Naturally, after reading the first couple of pages, I didn't notice how I made myself comfortable right there on the floor until hours later a librarian came through telling me the place was now closing for the night.<br />
<br />
Those few hours were the most bone-chilling of my life.  The oppressive darkness, my lonely helplessness, the masterfully creepy book, and most noticeable: the smell of age and experience many times greater than the length of my own life... I didn't doubt for a second that I'd be overcome by a horror I couldn't fend off; it was just a matter of when.  The poor librarian who startled me from my trance was probably momentarily as scared as I was when I jumped up out of the gloom with wild eyes upon hearing his voice.<br />
<br />
From then on, I could never refuse the absolutely haunting smell of the ages that makes you feel the weight of ancient knowledge with the simultaneous sense of your own insignificance and protection from things past.  Dusty old books indeed!  Try reading a classic while wearing this perfume - you will never want to watch tv again.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="104893"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=104893#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1327564" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1327564" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PhonePotato"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1224212"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1224212.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PhonePotato" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Aaron-Terence-Hughes/Supernova-90884.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90884.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Supernova"title="Supernova"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1327564ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1327564" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1224212">PhonePotato</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-18">04/18/21 05:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Yes, you should wear whatever fragrance you want BUT this one should be reserved for Victorian themed Halloween costumes. This is seems like a time capsule for me more that any other fragrance I’ve come across. It doesn’t smell dated, it smells antique. This is the signature scent of the Antiques Roadshow. <br />
<br />
I personally love using this before bed when I want to drift off and dream of this long gone era, or when I’m watching Sherlock Holmes shows.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="1327564"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=1327564#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1014276" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1014276" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="andrew1983"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1089141"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1089141.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="andrew1983" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5674.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Endymion"title="Endymion"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1014276ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1014276" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1089141">andrew1983</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-12-28">12/28/18 13:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Hammam Bouquet is an ancient smelling scent (made in 1872) that will bring you backwards in time, after a turkish bath of the 19th century in the center of London. <br />
<br />
It is reminiscent of old memories, the orient that lives in the north of Europe in that period.<br />
<br />
Despite it is a deep fragrance, with a big soul (musk, amber and woodsy notes), it preserve a "british clearness" (rose, lavander and jasmine notes).<br />
<br />
Vote: 10/10 - I love it... for fall / wintertime</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="1014276"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=1014276#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent269482" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc269482" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="marmalator"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/143698"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="marmalator" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Escentric-Molecules/Escentric-01-846.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.846.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Escentric 01"title="Escentric 01"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma269482ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd269482" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/143698">marmalator</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-07-19">07/19/12 19:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I eventually bought this after sniffing it longingly from a sample vial for two or three years, having first read about it in Juliet Nicholson's superb book, "The Perfect Summer" (all about the latter days of Edwardian England). I don't wear it as much as I would like because it is so bold and floral, not at all like lightweight modern male fragrances (presumably because we now have daily showers, deodorant and don't chain-smoke cigars). It is harder to pull off successfully today, as it was created in an age when the only people who could afford it were rich gentlemen of leisure. <br />
<br />
However, I absolutely love it and still think it really works a room. Hammam Bouquet is an extremely complex scent that develops beautifully and lasts forever. It's got a viscous, oily quality and is a rich golden colour. Despite the heavy and dominant rose, it is a completely masculine scent due to the underlying lavender note and muskiness. I don't find this at all feminine, and have been complimented on how clean and fresh I smell wearing it. It's not 'dirty' or old-fashioned, at least not on me. Projection and sillage are outstanding and unrivalled even by costlier, newer creations. I love wearing this to the theatre or a smart club. When you wear this, you feel special and exclusive. I imagine myself knocking back a large Scotch with King Edward VII over a game of bridge at Boodles. Fin de siecle decadence in a bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="269482"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=269482#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent820974" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc820974" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fishwife"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1033613"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1033613.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fishwife" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Molton-Brown/Fiery-Pink-Pepper-Eau-de-Parfum-57718.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57718.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fiery Pink Pepper Eau de Parfum"title="Fiery Pink Pepper Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma820974ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd820974" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1033613">fishwife</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-05-08">05/08/17 21:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Like being lost in an old victorian home rummaging through the closets...very powdery rose with some musk thrown in for good measure...this is an old school dandy perfume, but in today's world would work on a man or woman...I really like this, as it feels like a timewarp to another century...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="820974"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=820974#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="3938" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent790193" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc790193" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MEOWITSTERRA"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/585360"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.585360.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MEOWITSTERRA" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lush/Rose-Jam-2019-63243.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.63243.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose Jam 2019"title="Rose Jam 2019"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma790193ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd790193" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/585360">MEOWITSTERRA</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-02-06">02/06/17 22:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a very tricky one, and it is the oldest style fragrance I've ever worn aside from sniffing Mitsouko once. <br />
<br />
The beginning was not pleasant at all, smelling of musty flowers, moss, and wood with cat urine.<br />
<br />
After giving it an hour, it turns into this pretty honeyed green rose with some suede and I also can detect sandalwood. <br />
<br />
It is not something I'd wear personally, but I am super happy to sample a piece of perfume history. What a different world it was.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="790193"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=790193#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent466734" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc466734" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Redbeard"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.537021.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Redbeard" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma466734ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd466734" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021">Redbeard</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-03-15">03/15/14 09:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Hammam Bouquet is very difficult for me because the florals are so heavy and overpowering. Smelling it again, I don't find it as immediately "old lady" smelling as I did before, but I still doubt I could ever wear it. Most heavy masculine florals are unappealing to me, though, so if they're your thing then don't let me dissuade you. It reminds me of two Aramis scents...JHL, which is more leathery in a way that I don't like, and 900, which is a cleaner, more rose-centric scent (the one masculine rose I've found that makes sense to my nose!). I would take 900 over Hammam Bouquet or most others in the genre, but I still recognize the depths of HB's richness.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="466734"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=466734#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent192507" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc192507" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aur-ha-kadosh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11123"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.11123.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aur-ha-kadosh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma192507ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd192507" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11123">Aur-ha-kadosh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-10-26">10/26/11 05:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>very lavandery scent, seems to look like a fresh eau de toilette but in the very first meaning when you take a bath or after a hammam you could use this to parachieve your cleansing, for me this is not a perfume</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="192507"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=192507#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent343275" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc343275" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="victoria.rogers.984"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/435682"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.435682.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="victoria.rogers.984" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tocca/Cleopatra-4839.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4839.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cleopatra"title="Cleopatra"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma343275ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd343275" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/435682">victoria.rogers.984</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-03-07">03/07/13 06:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was really, really excited to try this one.  Alas, on me, it smelled of baby powder.  My husband thought so, co-workers thought so. . .  I was really disappointed.  Maybe it was simply my body chemistry, or I got a bad sample, but it was really one note on me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="343275"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=343275#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent756627" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc756627" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Redpula"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/126594"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.126594.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Redpula" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Green-Irish-Tweed-474.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.474.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Green Irish Tweed"title="Green Irish Tweed"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma756627ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd756627" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/126594">Redpula</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-10-29">10/29/16 10:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is not for me. Yes I love rose and could smell it but the blend with other flowers like jasmine and heavy lavender plus soft citrus, orris root and pronounced cedar makes it a revolting, waxy and airy bouquet that I just can't approve as its causing sharp stings to my nose. <br />
It's not too powdery but very waxy that I also detected a mimosa "impression", which I do not go well with. <br />
I am not a fan of cedar and mimosa, so I thumbs down on this bouquet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3938"comment_id="756627"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Hammam-Bouquet-3938.html?ccid=756627#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="3938" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="search-reviews"><search-perfume-reviews :perfume_id="3938":random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]"></search-perfume-reviews></div></div><foundation-tabs></foundation-tabs></reviews-wrapper></div><perfume-shortcut-menu :perfume_id="3938" when-hidden="#toptop"></perfume-shortcut-menu><initialize-status-data></initialize-status-data><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_footer -->

    </div>
</div>                        <div id="popBrands" class="strike-title" style="margin-top: 4em;"><span>Most Popular Perfumes</span></div>
            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-y grid-margin-x text-center">
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
        <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">1.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Khamrah-75805.html" class="en2inter">Khamrah Lattafa Perfumes</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">2.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Le-Male-Elixir-81642.html" class="en2inter">Le Male Elixir Jean Paul Gaultier</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">3.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/By-Kilian/Angels-Share-62615.html" class="en2inter">Angels&#039; Share By Kilian</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">4.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Le-Male-Le-Parfum-61856.html" class="en2inter">Le Male Le Parfum Jean Paul Gaultier</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            </div>
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">5.&nbsp;</span>

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFFe5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
